headline.main: LIFELINE OF SICILY HIT AT BOTH ENDS; Messina Bombed From North Africa, Reggio Calabria From Middle East

lead_paragraph: ALLIED HEADQUARTERS IN NORTH AFRICA, June 30 -- Bombers from Northwest Africa and the Middle East converged on the Strait of Messina on Monday night. They hammered Messina, the Sicilian terminus of the train ferry service, which is the shortest line of communication between the island and Italy and Reggio Calabria, one of the mainland ports for the ferries.
abstract: Allies bomb Messina and Reggio Calabria train ferry terminals; Malta-based bombers attack Comiso airfield, Sicily
